data.title: Una Stubbs and Emma Barton Share A Deep Bond, With Barton Fondly Calling Stubbs Her “Aunt” Off-Camera
data.meta_description: Despite lacking a blood connection, Emma Barton and Una Stubbs are united by their mutual love for acting forged on the series 'EastEnders.'
data.text:
Key Takeaways

Una Stubbs and Emma Barton’s connection transcended the screen as they portrayed fictional relatives.

Stubbs’ portrayal of Barton’s aunt on EastEnders led some viewers to believe there was a familial connection outside the show.

The bond between Stubbs and Barton resonates deeply, with Barton affectionately referring to Stubbs as her “Aunt” even off-camera.

Despite lacking a blood connection, Emma Barton and Una Stubbs are united by their mutual love for acting, forged further through their work together on the series ‘EastEnders.’

Their family backgrounds show that Emma Barton and Una Stubbs have no familial ties.

The Fictional and Real Bonds of Una Stubbs and Emma Barton

In 2006, Una Stubbs and Emma Barton played fictional relatives on screen (EastEnders), but their connection didn’t end when the cameras stopped rolling.

While Stubbs portrayed Barton’s aunt for a brief period, their friendship continued beyond the set. However, it’s worth clarifying that they’re not related in real life.

Emma joined the show in 2005, taking on the role of Honey Mitchell, a character central to numerous family-centric storylines.

Una appeared on the show in 2006, appearing in only six episodes as Caroline, Honey Mitchell’s aunt.

This mistakenly led viewers to believe they have a familial tie outside the show, but that’s not the case.

Despite their short on-screen time together, their bond felt like family.

Emma affectionately refers to Una as her “Aunt” even when they’re not filming.

In interviews, Emma has openly expressed her joy in calling Una her aunt, reflecting the genuine affection between the two actresses.

Emma Barton and Una Stubbs Don’t Share Any Familial Ties

Emma Barton, daughter of Penelope and David Barton, was born on July 26, 1977, in Portsmouth, Hampshire, England.

She attended Horndean Community School from 1989 to 1993 before pursuing her passion for acting at the Guildford School of Acting, where she graduated in 1998.

Previously married to lawyer Nigel Stoat, the couple tied the knot in 2002 but sadly parted ways three years later, shortly after Barton’s debut on EastEnders.

On the other hand, Una Stubbs, born on May 1, 1937, in Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire, England, is the daughter of Clarence Reginald Stubbs and Angela K. Rawlinson.

Growing up in Hinckley, Leicestershire, she was enrolled in La Roche dancing school in Slough by her mother.

Stubbs was married to actor Peter Gilmore from 1958 to 1969, during which they adopted a son named Jason.

Following their divorce, she wed actor Nicky Henson, though their marriage ended in 1975.

Despite their split, Stubbs and Henson remained close friends.

She and Henson were blessed with two children: composer Christian Henson, born on December 25, 1971, and musician-composer Joe Henson, born on September 18, 1973.

In Case You Didn’t Know

Emma has been in a relationship with Jason Perry, a music producer and former frontman of the British rock band A, for over a year.
